conclusion: Determine the current I of the constant current source based on the given information.
Identify the forces acting on the mover: The mover is accelerated by the magnetic force and the retraction force.
The magnetic force is given by F = (800 - 10v)N.
The retraction force is F = 800 - 10v N.
Determine the acceleration of the mover: The acceleration a can be calculated as a = F/m = (800 - 10v)N/5kg.
Calculate the velocity of the mover: The velocity v can be calculated as v = ∫ a dt = ∫ (800 - 10v)N/5kg dt.
Determine the time t1: The time t1 can be calculated as t1 = ∫ v dt = ∫ (800 - 10v)N/5kg dt.
Calculate the time t2: The time t2 can be calculated as t2 = ∫ v dt = ∫ (800 - 10v)N/5kg dt.
Calculate the time t3: The time t3 can be calculated as t3 = ∫ v dt = ∫ (800 - 10v)N/5kg dt.
Calculate the current I: The voltage V can be calculated as V = ∫ v dt = ∫ (800 - 10v)N/5kg dt.
Calculate the current I: The resistance R can be calculated as R = V/I.
Calculate the current I: The current I can be calculated as I = V/R.
Given the information: v1 = 80m/s, t1 = 1.5s, n = 100, l = 1m, M = 10kg, R0 = 9.5Ω, B = 0.1T.
Integrating v over time: v = ∫ (160 - 2v) dt = 160t - 2∫ t dt = 160t - t^2.
Integrating v again: v = ∫ (160t - t^2) dt = 80t^2 - t^3/3 + C.
Using the initial condition v = 80m/s at t = 0: 80(0)^2 - (0)^3/3 + C = 80, C = 80.
